author: dcspark
title: Milkomeda SPO validator training
description: Milkomeda requiere un conjunto distribuido de validadores para lograr una descentralización suficiente

f6_assessments.q0: Stakepool es probablemente el corazón de Cardano. También es uno de los principales actores del ecosistema, si no el más importante.  Cuanto mejor sea su sustento, mejor será para la comunidad de Cardano en su conjunto. Lo ideal es que la cadena lateral de Cardano esté tan descentralizada como la cadena principal. Con todos los nuevos incentivos de staking (token, NFTs airdrop, etc) que tenemos los últimos meses en forma de ISPO, muchos pools más pequeños y menos populares están luchando por mantener sus ADAs delegados. Participar en la gestión de la sidechain de Cardano será probablemente la respuesta que necesitan para mantener su lealtad a nuestra blockchain mientras siguen cumpliendo los objetivos de todas las partes implicadas con algunos incentivos. Por lo tanto, estoy de acuerdo en que necesitamos poner más recursos en este tema en general y esta propuesta será un gran comienzo.
f6_assessments.q1: La combinación de conocimientos, habilidades y experiencia en el equipo de dcSpark probablemente hablará por sí misma. Sin embargo, no puedo negar que todavía faltan algunos detalles. Tal vez podamos empezar por saber más cosas, como calibrar cuántos SPOs están interesados con la perspectiva, las calificaciones de los SPOs, los parámetros de la piscina requeridos, etc.  Dado que la beta de la red principal de Milkomeda se lanzará de forma inminente, se puede decir que la propuesta se entregará rápidamente y se alineará con el calendario de desarrollo de la cadena de bloques.
f6_assessments.q2: Aunque todavía no se menciona la métrica para medir con precisión el resultado de la implementación de esta propuesta, creo que esto se puede averiguar y probar fácilmente más adelante cuando se implementen las cosas mencionadas en la sección de viabilidad. Sin embargo, sería mejor si tuviéramos algún resumen adjunto a la propuesta. El Github de la propia Milkomeda es lo suficientemente genial como para indicar la calidad del trabajo que producirá el equipo. Esperemos que en las próximas semanas podamos ver más anuncios positivos en forma de beta en vivo.

f6_assessments.q0: Connecting Cardano to EVM is a great solution to scale and connect Cardano with other blockchain platforms, especially Ethereum. But I really haven't seen a specific plan, roadmap or a specific description of the product of the proposal, so I still don't really know how the product will be implemented and what the specific solution is. . Although the proposal wants to be funded to audit the project, the proposer also needs to be more specific about the product
f6_assessments.q1:
"Proposer said their Team is composed of well known ex-Emurgo and ex-IOHK employees who have been building the Cardano ecosystem for the past several years but no evidence provided of team's experience and size of the team. Providing profile links, github pages or links to past projects your team worked on will boost voter confidence in your capabilities in making this project a reality. 
In addition, a specific description of the project's product and roadmap is indispensable to know the feasibility of the proposal."
f6_assessments.q2:
"There is no specific product description, no roadmap, No info has been provided to show how this project will solve the problems it wants to solve. There is no way to track the progress or success of this project.

Proposer said they plan to start the audit as soon as possible. They will release the final audit report to the community once we have addressed any issues found. But we don't even know what their product is"

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer is clear with their objectives to support their current running project. Above all, this training is for stake pool operators, an important role in the Cardano ecosystem. With decentralization in mind, this proposal will have a positive impact that supports the Cardano development.
f6_assessments.q1: Success likelihood is very high considering the proposer is also the developer behind the Milkomeda. But, the proposal doesn't mention the training schedules, modules, and the detailed budget plan breakdown. How many stake pool operators are eligible for the subsequent training sessions? If the stake pool operators are not selected for the validation process, are they still considered members of Milkomeda DAO? Otherwise, it will have risks of becoming a centralized sidechain.
f6_assessments.q2: Although the proposal has its official website, it should have other social media channels to update the training progress or documentation. It should be announced as well in the dcSpark social media channels. And, of course, training milestones and amount of stake pool operators joined should be announced too.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer outlines the task of providing documentation and training to stake pool operators to make it easier for them to learn about and run a Milkomeda validator. The Milkomedia sidechain brings EVM support to the Cardano blockchain. As the ROI of ADA decreases for staking rewards over time as less inflation is offered by the protocol SPOs will need to have more income from other sources such as transaction fees or other validators and nodes. The Milkomeda validator node provides on of these business opportunities for SPOs and making it easy to learn and start using those validators presents an impactful opportunity and business model that can help the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal team have a history working within IOG and Emurgo. The team now operators their own company dcSpark and have completed a number of Catalyst proposal that have shown they can execute the proposals they get funded for. The proposal team created the Milkomeda sidechain so are naturally also the right people to train others to start running the validator nodes required by the sidechain to operate.

Ideally the proposal team would have broken down the budget more and given a better itemised list of exactly what the documentation would include and how they are training the SPOs in december.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal team gave an outline of starting work in December training the validators. No success objectives or KPIs were provided. It would have been good to understand what a successfully trained validator would look like. Perhaps they have covered some specific amount of content or have demonstrated a certain understanding. Or potentially it could be looking at the metrics for their validator and that they meet the thresholds for what would be considered a node that is being run correctly. The plan has clarity however some more information here would have made it easier for advisors to know how this will be audited when providing evidence of the impact the proposal has had.

solution: Planeamos escribir documentación para ayudar a cualquier grupo de interés que quiera ser un validador de Milkomeda y también ayudar a los validadores con cualquier pregunta
experience: Nuestro equipo está compuesto por conocidos ex empleados de Emurgo y ex empleados de IOHK que han estado construyendo el ecosistema de Cardano durante los últimos años
